intro: Anthericum caudatum, commonly known as the tailed bellflower, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Anthericum caudatum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
